abstract: Two district court judges have tried to supervise deferred prosecution agreements, only to be blocked by appellate courts.
snippet: Two district court judges have tried to supervise deferred prosecution agreements, only to be blocked by appellate courts.
lead_paragraph: The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit has shut down a nascent but necessary effort by trial judges to supervise deferred prosecution agreements.

headline.main: Judges Left Out of Deferred Prosecution Agreements
